This is DEVELOPER issue. SELECT element added dynamically to DOM by JavaScript to parent DIV.


Actual results:

I am experiencing strange bug only in firefox related to SELECT element positioning.  SELECT Has 2 pixels topOffset from parent element even when margins and padding of SELECT and his parent are set to 0. Please see attachech images.

Reproduction:
1. select-bad-offsetTop.jpg shows problem with SELECT element
2. Then I change dynamically by firebug element type to INPUT and everything is ok then. see image. input-right-offsetTop.jpg 

I Can provide testing enviroment to reproduce this problem.




Expected results:

By my research problem is related to offsetTop property, offsetTop should be 0, but it is set to 2;

Its not easy to access the page.  You will have to login to our online form builder:

GOTO:
- http://manager.formees.com/
- login as user: "bugreportmozilla"
- password: "password"
- goto "Designer" of first form (button on item toolbar)

- you will see misplaced SELECT there, for better visibility of problem I have added gray boxes around "widget". The widget consist of SELECT element wrapped in DIV element. Use firebug to inspect DOM, there are many absolute positioned  elements on page. 

- then you can compare to rendering on following page, same styles are used, and problems does not happen: http://bugreportmozilla.formees.com/f/bugreport-firefox/
